name: The Mecca Center
mission: The Fund is formed as an endowment in support of the Muslim Educational Cultural Center of America DBA The Mecca Center

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a score of 27/50, the organization shows moderate alignment by serving urgent religious and cultural needs through Zakat-eligible programs [2][9]. The high donor fit for the Muslim community is supported by its focus on Quranic education and youth engagement, though the track record is primarily documented through internal by-laws rather than external reporting [4][10].
dimension_explanations.impact: The Fund demonstrates a high capacity for long-term support with 124.0 months of working capital and a program expense ratio of 91.1% [1][3]. While its role in capacity building for the Mecca Center is clear, the overall impact score of 34/50 is limited by the absence of specific cost-per-beneficiary data and third-party performance evaluations [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Mecca Center Endowment Fund provides long-term financial stability for religious and educational programming within the Muslim community.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 91.1% indicating efficient use of funds for mission-related activities
Exceptional liquidity with 124.0 months of working capital available
Zakat-eligible status providing a verified channel for religious giving
baseline_narrative.summary: Established as a supporting endowment for the Muslim Educational Cultural Center of America, the Fund secures the future of vital community initiatives including the Mecca Quran Institute (MQI) and Sunday School [1][4]. The organization maintains a high level of financial efficiency, reporting total revenue of $1,523,429 and ensuring that resources are directed toward its core mission of capacity building [3].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize the long-term institutional sustainability of American Muslim educational infrastructure through endowment-style giving.

Seek to fulfill zakat through established community institutions
Prefer organizations with significant cash reserves and low financial risk

Limited public data is available regarding specific per-student impact costs
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-transparency organizations with large, diverse boards or those requiring rigorous third-party impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence of educational quality ensures that endowment funds are supporting effective pedagogical models.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As an endowment fund, it has unlimited capacity to absorb capital to generate perpetual support for community programs.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="5">91.1% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core mission and programs, demonstrating lean administrative operations.
With <cite id="7">124.0 months of working capital</cite> available, the fund has extraordinary long-term sustainability compared to industry standards.
The center's programs have been recognized with <cite id="8">1st place awards for best Quran Institute</cite> at major national conventions.

strengths_deep_dive: The Mecca Center Endowment Fund's financial model is built on extreme stability and growth. Its <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 179.4%</cite> indicates a successful transition from a small community fund to a significant institutional player. This is further evidenced by its <cite id="11">total assets of $4,134,653</cite> as of the 2023 tax year. The fund's ability to maintain a <cite id="12">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite> suggests that it leverages community-driven growth and volunteer support effectively, minimizing the cost of capital acquisition while maximizing the impact of every dollar donated.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2004, The Mecca Center Endowment Fund serves as a critical financial pillar for the Muslim Educational Cultural Center of America, ensuring the <cite id="1">long-term stability of religious and educational programming</cite>. The organization manages a diverse portfolio of services, including the <cite id="2">Mecca Quran Institute (MQI), Sunday School, and Quran Blossoms</cite>, which focus on spiritual development and community capacity building. Financially, the fund demonstrated significant growth in 2023, reporting <cite id="3">total revenue of $1,523,429</cite>, a sharp increase from previous years. This growth is supported by a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 179.4%</cite>, reflecting a rapidly expanding donor base and successful fundraising efforts. The organization is highly efficient in its resource allocation, maintaining a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 91.1%</cite>, which exceeds the <cite id="6">peer program ratio median of 89.6%</cite> for international education and religious charities. Furthermore, the fund exhibits <cite id="7">exceptional liquidity with 124.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a robust buffer against economic volatility. Beyond its financial health, the center has achieved external recognition for its educational quality, earning <cite id="8">1st place for best Quran Institute</cite> at the MAS–ICNA Convention for two consecutive years. As a <cite id="9">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, it provides a verified channel for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations, specifically serving the <cite id="10">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> categories.
